To finish off our summer vacation, my partner and I thought it would be perfect to visit Menendez (our 2nd visit). We both share a fondness of the mexican kitchen, making the choice a no-brainer.

We arrived early (too early if you ask me) and yet the service was extremely accomodating and heartwarm. Not the pretend-niceties one can encounter on fine-dining restaurants, but where the staff are allowed to show who they are, whilst maintaining a high level of skill and knowledge. Our main waitress especially had a knack of reading her guests - so naturally we hit it off immediately.

We chose the 12 servings dining experience (emphasis on experience), which took us through everything from churros with grated cheese to tostadas with octopus in XO sauce and an onion-oriented dish. It was paired with their wine-menu and aperitif (+ coffee after, which we skipped - by our own initiative).

We went to Menendez once and expected the same level of dining experience this time around, but were blown away this time. The first time was impeccable, making this visit unforgettable. The food was delicious, the wines were paired perfectly and the service was exactly as it should be: around when you needed it, but before you anticipated a need yourself.

It is, to me, the best restaurant in Aalborg. If you love mexican cuisine, definitely visit Menendez. If you have never tried mexican food - visit Menendez. 

Just visit Menendez!

Great service and great food.  We tried the smaller tasting menu and weren‚Äôt disappointed.  Most of the food has a warming heat but doesn‚Äôt blow your head off however if you like things a bit hotter a fantastic chilli paste is provided.

The waitress recommended a great wine to accompany our food, it was a very good choice.

There is an abundance of waiting staff who know what they are doing (no trying to catch their eye or trying to get another drink here).  They all speak Danish and English and will explain to you what the food is.
 .
We haven‚Äôt stopped raving about Menedez since we left. 

Don‚Äôt be scared to try this restaurant if you‚Äôre worried it will be too spicy for you, the staff will help you choose the right dishes for you.

We can‚Äôt wait to go back and try the larger tasting menu (allow 3 hours for this!)
Excellent food and great service. All servers were friendly and helpful. We ordered six dishes (chef's choice) and we were beyond satisfied with all six dishes.

Great food, very relaxed and friendly atmosphere and nice to try something  a little different from the usual classics. We loved the food - especially the hisbiscus ice dessert, wow - and thanks to our dutch waitress that smiled herself right into our hearts. Truly recommendable. We came tired and left happy.

One of the few restaurants to remain open on the first real day of COVID19 panic in Denmark. Understandably reeling from the almost complete cancellation of evening service, they fitted our multinational party in with a great bespoke group menu at short notice. Food was extremely impressive: fresh, delicious, beautifully presented and service is amongst the best I have had anywhere, anywhen. Fusion food can be disappointing but everything we had was inventive and tasty and didn't feel like a consolation prize for vegetarians/pescetarians.  We wish the staff all the very, very best in this chaotic period.

We were looking for a nice night out with a couple of friends/colleagues and the restaurant we had originally planned was full - which is why we got to discover this fantastic location!

They offer many dishes "tapas-style" and you order in rounds, which puts a really nice balance between eating and having some time in between for drinks and chatter.

We went for the tasting experience where you get to try a bit of everything. Their incredibly friendly service explained each dish as most of us had never tried such traditional food. Special mention to the dutch waitress that explained it all in English because we were an international group. She did a fantastic job translating and looking after us and we actually shared this experience with a lot of friends the next day. Sorry again! ;)

Definitely recommended - also you should order a Guava instead of a coke!

Menendez is worth a visit. The atmoshere is cosy (albeit that the music is just a bit too loud). We had the‚ÄùMenendez menu‚Äù, which was varied and interesting. The kitchen puts an effort into the food, and the service is very good. The main course (chicken with spring onions and sauce) was the only (very minor) disappointment, as it was too salty. Otherwise delicious food, with excellent wine pairing. Go!

We tried the full Menendez package and were happy with the food, even though the service could have been more knowledgeable about the drink pairing. Up until the food poisoning symptoms kicked in, that is, and ruined the mood and the entire following day. We notified the restaurant but received a rude and dismissive response, denying any responsibility. We were very disappointed that our notice was not taken more seriously, because we enjoyed the concept and would have liked to become recurring customers.Sad.

Saturday night, the second day of operation and the place was full!

Had the 9 servings course, which was excellent!

So many flavors and different dishes: Taco's, ceviche Tuna and Halibut, beans, sweet churros and so one.
Of course lots of lime and coriander. At the price I think this was fantastic; Looked great and tasted even better.

Staff were friendly, polite and introduced the food perfectly.
Interior is nice, actually a very cozy room to be in.
Definitely, a place I will come back to!

My brother‚Äôs here for a conference and my niece and I tagged along. On our last night  in the city we decided to explore a little bit and looked for a place to have dinner. 

We chances upon Bof & Vin and we weren‚Äôt disappointed! There were options for outdoor and indoor seating  but it was such a lovely weather so the tables outside were filled. We had the corner table inside the restaurant and it was lovely, well lit and comfy. 

I had the menu for the month which consisted of shrimp and salmon salad - just okay, nothing amazing but the plating was pretty enough. 

The steak though was the best! It was striploin and done a perfect medium, just the way I want it! My brother had lamb chops and it was done so perfectly!

The dessert was heavenly. It was a kind of vanilla ice cream pistachios and a layer of cake with small slices of watermelon and pineapple on the side. 

I liked the wine, too. But I couldn‚Äôt drink too much because I‚Äôm on medications. 

Service was slow initially, took awhile for the server to get our orders but she was really nice, efficient and friendly. 

The location can‚Äôt be beat! We were able to do a little bit more sightseeing after dinner. 

It was a great way to spend our last night in Aalborg!

One of two restaurants on the harbor side in N√∂rresundby (the other being Victor‚Äôs Madhus ‚Äì separate review), Lille Nyhavn specializes in Danish open sandwiches. They are generally doing a good job; I have eaten there twice and been satisfied, the price taken into consideration. The food is well prepared and inviting. Portions aren‚Äôt all that large, and the selection of beer and schnapps modest, but the price is also in the lower end compared to other restaurants with a similar menu. They have a nice porch facing south which is a preferable choice provided the weather is agreeable. Albeit situated at the harbor side, there is no (panoramic) view of the fjord.
In conclusion; if you are looking for a piece of Denmark and want to lunch at reasonable prices, Lille Nyhavn is not a bad choice at all.

We had been here once before and liked the food, but found the service to be very slow, but we tried it again and it was so so bad service. We ordered one soup and two main courses with a a bottle of wine, on a Saturday evening, at seven. We waited half an hour for the soup, which when it came was excellent. We then waited another half an hour for our main course, which again was excellent. We  had spoken with the waiter concerning the delay with the first course, but when we raised the delay with him concerning the second course he became quite assertive, if not down right aggressive. It is one thing to have to wait an hour for food, it is quite another to be subjected to verbal aggression when you bring this to the attention of your waiter. I can only surmise that perhaps he has been trained in the traffic police. This ruined out Saturday evening, and was only partially redeemed by the intervention of the senior waiter and the offer of gratis coffee and tea at the end of the meal. Overall a very unpleasant experience...but the food was good. It however does emphasis just how important proper staff training is.

I was actually disappointed after my visit along with my wife.
There were no issues with the preparation of the food or drinks, but the overall experience was lacking;  We arrived 18.40 and left just before 20.00

In that time we had pre-dinner cocktails and a two-course meal and spent time wondering if we wanted dessert, I think that was to fast.

We did not finish our pre-dinner drink before our starters and accompanying cocktails arrived, the same happened after the starters; cocktails arrived before we finished that starter and the food came very shortly after.
No time to enjoy or just sit and talk.
Furthermore, the main course was a piece of organic Pork Neck Fillet which is, of course, a nice piece of meat. But it is also a very cheap and standard piece of meat. A bit disappointing when you go out for a nice dinner. The drink served along with the main course was a drink based on red wine, mead, honey, and pepper, which we both thought was all too sweet and did not accompany the food very well.

So as such, there was nothing wrong with service, food or presentation of it, it was just very much below expectations.

It is not very often I have the pleasure to post one of the First reviews of restaurant opened four days ago. So here goes. The risotto was not the absolutte best I have had, but comes close. Vol au Vent exttemely tasty. Service was excellent, beer selection acceptable. New Kid in Town is here to stay. Outside seating is so inviting, and on these cool sommer evenings just ask for the terrasse heaters to be turned on.

Visiting the Viking Museum, stopped off at Cafe Lindholm to grab a takeaway coffee.

We went for a late lunch before visiting the museum (which is also recommended) and were greeted by the chef, who explained the menu to us. We shared a delicious platter of local charcuterie and cheeses with pickles and chutneys.  These were accompanied by a selection of excellent breads made on the premises. I also had some local draught beer, which was very good. The chef has written a cookery book, which was on sale (in Danish only). What impressed us was the care taken over the sourcing of food from local artisan producers as well as the good bread and beautiful presentation of the meal. This place is good enough to visit just for the food alone; it is more than just a functional museum cafe. The setting is light and bright , and altogether it set us up well for a long museum visit.

This place is so close to where I live, and we finally had an opportunity to stop and grab a pizza on the way home one day. They get loads of business, so we expected something special. The pizza (pepperoni with peppers and mushrooms) was bland and under seasoned. No flavour stood out and it was all very soggy. Instead of fresh mushrooms, they opted to used jarred or canned mushrooms, and a LOT of them. Canned mushrooms are watery and have an odd flavour to them, and there were handfuls on handfuls of them, which didn't help the sogginess and the blandness. 

I had high hopes, and maybe we didn't catch them on a good day, but I wouldn't buy another pizza from them to find out.

I am pretty sure that my Tuna went bad, and there was a yellow glow on it. Then I was scared to eat more raw fish there, unfortunately. The waiter and a chef both told me that they cook from fresh food, but I am sure that it wasn‚Äôt good.

Aalborg has plenty of "all-you-can-eat"-restaurants, but this on has taken the concept to a greater level. The make as you order, so it's always freshly made sushi. 
We paid 350 dk per person for food and drinks.

The concept of Suzumi differs from the countless of sushi buffets readily available in Aalborg. At Suzumi you get a menu, then you write down what sushi you want to eat, and it is served in small bundles, but the staff inform you about that. There is no sushi sitting out in a buffet waiting to be picked here. Instead, the chefs prepare your serving custom to what you just ordered, and it is brought to you on a wooden board, which adds to the authenticity of the Japanese dining experience. So the sushi you get here is made to your order, which is just fabulous. Sure, you have to wait a bit for your order to be prepared and brought to you. But believe me, the wait is worth it.

Why? Because the sushi is delicious, tasty and the serving on the wooden plate is just fabulous.

I was genuinely and wholeheartedly surprised with the concept here the first time I went there, which was for my wife and mine 10 year wedding anniversary. And we both left there with bellies full, a great dining experience richer and with an overall good impression of the restaurant - including staff, environment, food, hygiene, etc.

If you like sushi and find yourself in Aalborg, then don't skip out on trying this exquisite experience.

Had a lunch reservation for 4 and got a nice table with a view. Unfortunately, we did not see any wait staff at our table for 25 minutes. After 20 minutes I went up to the bar myself to order. 5 minutes later a waitress appeared (no apologies for the wait). Our drinks came (30 minutes after being seated) then our food. It was good, which is lucky, for no one came back to check if our food was OK. Fast forward 20 minutes - our beers were almost empty, yet no one came to ask if we would like another (Aktuel lost over kr. 200/$30 here). Fast forward 10 minutes - a waitress removed 2 of our finished plates. We wanted to order coffee and desert when she came back for the other 2, but she never came (Aktuel again lost over kr.200/$30). We never saw another waitress at our table, even though there were several chatting together behind the bar. When we paid our bill (at the bar) we said it was unfortunate we had to go somewhere else for coffee. 

Service is a huge part of the dining experience - and has a huge impact on a restaurant's income. Aktuel must have rich owners who do not care that their servers are costing them a fortune. There are plenty of restaurants in town eager for business during these Covid times. I will definitely choose another for our next "girls lunch" out on the town.

A very informal and cool restarant on Bodolfi place. Great outdoor seating. Service was a bit slow, but very friendly once you got their attention. Relatively smal menu ( a plus in my opinion ), with the possiblity to choose three of about 20 dishes for 150/160 DKK. Not cheap. The burgers looked tempting, but we chose rustik fries, deepfried shrimps, salmon and a veggie tartar. All very good, very nicely presented and small portions. Too small for the price, but again very tasty.

Considering non, or only very few reviews were in English, I thought I'd wright it in English.

Anyways, Aktuel is a mix of a cafe and a restaurant. It has an informal atmosphere and the place is more focused on the cafe part and is mostly meant for a quick drop in. My girlfriend and I went there for dinner. There's not a lot to choose from though. You can choose a set of 3 parts of small bowls. I was told that they would be equivalent to a full meal. They were not. The burger is also not very big. I'll recommend the visitors to use Aktuel as a drop in cafe for a light bite of food and a drink before heading into town. 

There are other places that are better in terms of food; both in price and in quality. 

Considering that this is written in July 2020 with corona - the guests are seated very close to each other and the room is quite cramped.

We walked in from the street, got ourselves a table and were surprised about how price friendly the place is. We ordered cocktails and the 3 part meal (150 kr). The staff were very friendly. The only thing to put a finger on is, that it's very bright inside the restaurant - bright like the sun!

I'll definitely return!

I thought I booked at the vegetarian restaurent Ubat Veggie by Tabu www but the booking system booked at general Tabu restaurant - and somehow the booking system is not booking a vegetarian menu although you look at Ubat Veggie by Tabu and not at Tabu. Showed up with an international vegetarian guest and the waiter told us we did not book a vegetarian menu and was not willing to accept that the booking was for Ubat Veggie by Tabu and not Tabu. Got the message that their restaurant concept and  booking system was changed 4 years ago - and the waiter pretended we should have know that we should have noted that we wanted vegetarian the reservation -  which again I thought as I booked and paid 48 hours in advance!!.
Had two wine choices and asked a simple question ranking the dryness but no convincing and qualified response was given. However they managed to make a PERFECT vegetarian menu with local products - the only exception was German caviar - so do not understand why this should be included. The chefs and the junior chefs  served the dishes and explained in a very competent and engaged way in fluently English all the single products included in each dish and where it came from.  This was a perfect service. The desserts was marginally tasty and not at the level of the many other dishes - all dishes well prepared and very artistically arranged. A great experience in general. Pity the introduction to the restaurant was hampered by the inherited  booking system mistakes.

This place has an enormous potential and it is very exciting to see a proper alternative to the usual restaurants in Aalborg.

We had lunch here and were basically the only ones there. The food we had was really good, very fresh products cooked in a simply yet light and refreshing way.

A couple of things that can still be fine-tuned like avoiding to overcook the pasta and the deserts need a gentle and more refined touch to make them less sweet and heavy. Perhaps a couple of more options on the menu.

Coffee was good although slightly to the burned side which makes the coffee a bit too strong in taste. I would recommend introducing the pour-over option for filter coffee. 

For the rest, again one of the most interesting places in Aalborg right a long with their sister restaurant next door.

Well done and keep it up! There is room for improving but I for one will return again and again when in Aalborg!

This restaurant has nailed it, superb vegetarian degustation. Every dish had its own character, you could taste the passion they were created with. Well balanced with the finest produce.
Service was outstanding with knowledge of every ingredient. Loved it and will come back when visiting beautiful Aalborg again.

Let me admit it. It was with some scepticism i entered Ubat for the first time. My daughter and her husband visited Aalborg and are both vegtarians, so that was the occation that caused my visit.
5 course meal and a outstanding delicious snack starter, was ordered from our table. And then we were accompanied by 2 bottles of the best Barolo i have had so far.
Let me admit it right away: I bend over in admiration for this experience. So much taste, so many awesome combinations, and such a great service. From now on I'm a fan. 
I highly recommend other meat lovers to challenge them self on Ubat Veggie. You'll never regret.

This restaurant is located in Radisson Blu Limfjord hotel Aalborg. Interestingly, there were several visitors who come from outside the hotel. 
I took antipasti buffet and pasta with beef and mushrooms. Antipasti buffet was very limited - octopus salad was very tough and rubbery, pasta was actually worst pasta dish I tried in past 12 months. Verdict: not recommended

King's Restaurant is a lovely place in Aalborg. Especially if you like sushi. Why? Because they have this running conveyer belt of sorts that have small plates with sushi and desserts running around, which captures that authentic Asian spirit. They have a nice selection of sushi, and a small selection of Asian cuisine as well. And for the kids, an all you can eat ice cream choice as part of the buffet.

The atmosphere is good; big and spacious room that has good table placement. It is near the heart of Aalborg. And it is affordable.

Ordered the Running Sushi, a concept we have tried before at other restaurants. We did show up a little late 7:45 pm but still we expected better than what was available. The sushi belt was in two stories with the top deck carrying slices of orange, melon, some sweets etc. lower deck with the sushi. I am not aware how they control how long each plate is running on the belt, but some of the more recognizable dishes were there all the time we were there. 
The belt was cold which is not good for the rice. They were chewy and sticking to the plates big time.  
Included in the price is a buffet, which was worse. Hardly anything left and the little we tried was very dry. 
The place is affordable DKK169 but still not worth it. Rather go for less food and better quality. We have tried other and better sushi places in Aalborg - more expensive mind. Cannot recommend this as a sushi place which is probably why it is not listed as such on TripAdvisor.

King¬¥s running sushi is very cosy and friendly restaurant where you can sit and the sushi will come to you or you can find asian buffet near the wall in front of the entrance. However, the staff is not very good in English and we had some difficulties in understanding each other. The restaurant was clean and as mentioned in the title, the sushi was the best among the other sushi restaurants I have tried. You can eat "all you can" for an affordable price  99kr. during the lunch time.

Fun place to be with friends and enjoy tasty sushi. It is not the best sushi you can find in town but it is affordable since for 169kr. you can have all your can eat from the running sushi, the thai buffet, ice cream and coffee. It is also a spacious family place appropriate for kids.

The Sushi at King's is very tasty and the prices are absolutely reasonable. The additional Chinese Buffet is nothing special, but okay. I prefer the Sushi there! 
In addition, the stuff is super friendly!

I tried Holy Cow with my husband one evening, and I ended up leaving nearly the entire burger on the plate. My husband ordered a regular burger, while I ordered the fungi burger. My mushroom sauce was also not seasoned, making it taste like bland, slighlty mushroomy cream with a LOT of cheap truffel oil added to it. 

The restaurant itself is actually really nice! Very cozy. Again, the fries were amazing (the onion rings are the ones you can buy in local supermarkets and cook in the oven, though). Holy Cow had a ton of potential, but needs someone a bit more experienced in the kitchen who knows how to taste what they're producing.
